meanings.definition: Having the same rate and extent of absorption
meanings.sent1: The two medications are bioequivalent in how quickly and how much the body absorbs them.
meanings.sent2: The bioequivalent pills are absorbed by the body at the same speed and to the same degree.
meanings.sent3: It's like both pills are absorbed by the body at the same speed, like synchronized dancers.
meanings.sent4: Their absorption rates are bioequivalent, like two cars racing at the same speed on a track.
meanings.sent5: The bioequivalent absorption ensures both pills work equally well in the body.

meanings.definition: A drug product that is pharmaceutically equivalent to another product
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist recommended the bioequivalent generic version of the medication.
meanings.sent2: She decided to switch to the bioequivalent drug to save money.
meanings.sent3: The bioequivalent pill is like the twin of the original medication.
meanings.sent4: Choosing the bioequivalent option is like getting the same cake with a different frosting.
meanings.sent5: The bioequivalent drug has the same effect as the brand-name one.

meanings.definition: The ability of two drugs to produce the same effect in the body
meanings.sent1: The bioequivalent of the two drugs ensures they work the same way in the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often prescribe bioequivalent medications to achieve consistent results.
meanings.sent3: It's like the drugs have a secret handshake to be bioequivalent in the body.
meanings.sent4: Their bioequivalent nature is like a perfect harmony in the body's symphony.
meanings.sent5: The bioequivalent drugs guarantee the desired effect without variation.
